verse: त्र्यम्बकं यजामहे सुगंधिं पुष्टिवर्द्धनम् उर्वारुकमिव बन्धनान्मृत्योर्मुक्षीय माऽमृतात् ॥

terms.बन्धनान्मृत्योर्मुक्षीय (bandhanān: mṛtyor-mukṣīya) - Free us from the bondage of death
terms.We worship the three: eyed Lord (Shiva), who is fragrant and nourishes all beings. May He release us from the bondage of death, just as a ripe cucumber is effortlessly released from its stem. May He lead us to immortality.
terms.This verse is a part of the Mahamrityunj: eyed deity, is worshipped as the supreme destroyer of all sorrows and suffering. The verse describes Him as the one who supports growth, like the fragrance that emanates from a flower. The analogy of a ripe cucumber effortlessly detaching from its stem signifies the liberation from the cycle of birth and death that Lord Shiva bestows upon His devotees. The prayer concludes with a plea for attaining immortality, representing the ultimate goal of spiritual evolution.
